## Description {#details}

<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> wrapper in the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/metadata">Metadata</a> hierarchy.

This is a custom value handle that allows other metadata to refer to classes in the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> hierarchy.

Because of full uniquing support, each value is only wrapped by a single <em><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/valueasmetadata">ValueAsMetadata</a></em> object, so the lookup maps are far more efficient than those using <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/valuehandlebase">ValueHandleBase</a>.

Definition at line 454 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/metadata-h">Metadata.h</a>.

## Protected Member Functions

### replaceAllUsesWith() {#a3011a4758b31e15d77951d24386c68bf}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void llvm::ValueAsMetadata::replaceAllUsesWith (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/metadata">Metadata</a> &#42; MD)</>}
  labels = {["inline", "protected"]}>
Handle collisions after <em><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value/#a3ab5fc45117b450e8bb04e564cb6e5f2">Value::replaceAllUsesWith()</a></em>.

RAUW isn&#39;t supported directly for <em><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/valueasmetadata">ValueAsMetadata</a></em>, but if the wrapped <em><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a></em> gets RAUW&#39;ed and the target already exists, this is used to merge the two metadata nodes.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/metadata-h/#l00514">514</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/metadata-h">Metadata.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

</SectionDefinition>
